articles.author: Lisandra Paraguassu, Anthony Boadle
articles.description: Leaders of the Group of 20 major economies were set to meet on Monday in Brazil for their annual summit, bracing for a shift in the global order with the return to power of U.S. president-elect Donald Trump.
articles.title: G20 summit confronts a global order unsettled by Trump's return

articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Ukraine marked 1,000 days on Tuesday since Russia's full-scale invasion, with weary troops battling on numerous fronts, Kyiv besieged by frequent drone and missile strikes, and officials preparing for Donald Trump to reclaim the White House in January.
articles.title: Ukraine, marking 1,000 days of Russian invasion, eyes end to war next year

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum spoke with both outgoing U.S. President Joe Biden as well as Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on the sidelines of the G20 summit in Brazil on Monday.
articles.title: North American leaders talk cooperation on G20 sidelines

articles.author: Lucy Craymer, Lewis Jackson
articles.description: A nine-day march by Maori and their supporters across New Zealand has culminated in Wellington on Tuesday at a rally with thousands readying to protest against a bill that opponents say seek to dilute the rights of the Maori.
articles.title: Thousands protesting New Zealand's Indigenous bill set to march to parliament

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: The U.S. Senate could vote as soon as Wednesday on legislation that would block arms sales to Israel, backed by lawmakers who say Israel is obstructing aid shipments desperately needed by Palestinian civilians in Gaza.
articles.title: U.S. Senate to consider measures blocking some weapons sales to Israel

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said on Monday that Israel's air attack on Iran last month hit an element of Tehran's nuclear programme while degrading its defence and missile production capabilities.
articles.title: Netanyahu says Israel's October attack hit a component in Iran nuclear programme

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said on Monday he would discuss the delivery of dual-use goods with Chinese President Xi Jinping at the G20 summit, following a report that a Chinese factory is producing military drones for Russia.
articles.title: Germany's Scholz to address drones for Russia with China's Xi

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping warned at the Group of 20 Summit in Rio de Janeiro that artificial intelligence should not be a "game of rich countries and the wealthy," state news agency Xinhua reported on Monday.
articles.title: China's Xi tells G20 Summit AI should not be a 'game of rich countries,' Xinhua reports

articles.author: Daphne Psaledakis, Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: Members of the United Nations Security Council called on Monday for a surge in assistance to reach people in need in Israeli-basieged Gaza, warning that the situation in the Palestinian enclave was getting worse.
articles.title: Members of UN Security Council call for surge in assistance to Gaza

articles.author: Laila Bassam
articles.description: Lebanon and Hezbollah have agreed to a U.S. proposal for a ceasefire with Israel with some comments on the content, a top Lebanese official told Reuters on Monday, describing the effort as the most serious yet to end to the fighting.
articles.title: Lebanon, Hezbollah agree to US proposal for ceasefire with Israel, Lebanese official says
